hackathon-description-text: We are Melbourne's premier student hackathon - run for students, by students from WIRED Monash.

hackathon-judges.judge-role: Director of Strategy and New Business, Australia, Mashery
Head of UX & Innovation at Foxley, UX Business Consultant

hackathon-eligibility: UNIHACK is open to all university and TAFE students in Australia. The only requirement is that you must be an enrolled undergraduate, honours, postgraduate or TAFE student when UNIHACK starts on July 30. We reserve the right to cancel your ticket if you do not meet this requirement.

hackathon-prizes.prize-content: Adobe Creative Cloud for each member
A KAISER BAAS Drone for each member
A Xbox One for each member
Up to $500 worth of Bosch products from across the range
hackathon-prizes.prize-title: IOT: INVENTED FOR LIFE PRIZE (Sponsored by Bosch)

hackathon-prizes.prize-content: A student ticket to TEDx Melbourne for each member
hackathon-prizes.prize-title: UNIVERSAL DESIGN AWARD (Sponsored by Seamless CMS)

hackathon-prizes.prize-content: A customised WASD V2 keyboard for each member
hackathon-prizes.prize-title: MOST ELEGANT ALGORITHM AWARD (Sponsored by IMC)

hackathon-prizes.prize-content: A $100 iTunes voucher for each member
hackathon-prizes.prize-title: BEST USE OF TDD PRIZE (Sponsored by Thoughtworks)

hackathon-prizes.prize-content: A seat in PwC's STEM Academy for each member
A Xero Developer Pack each member
hackathon-prizes.prize-title: BEST MARKETPLACE READY HACK (Sponsored by Xero)
BEST STUDENT SOLUTION (Sponsored by Monash University eSolutions)

hackathon-location-google-maps: https://maps.google.com/?q=700 Swanston St, Carlton VIC 3053, Australia

hackathon-judging-criteria.judging-criterion: Is the hack more than just another generic social/mobile/local app? Does it do something entirely novel, or at least take a fresh approach to an old problem?
Is the hack technically interesting or difficult? Is it just some lipstick on an API, or were there any technical challenges to surmount when building it?

Is the hack usable in its current state? Is the user experience smooth? Does it work as the creators say? Is it well designed? Our judges will see and/or want to use your prototype - so make sure it works!

Is the hack practical? Is it something people would actually use? Does it fulfil a real need that people have? While you are not required to prepare a business plan, your app should have an audience identified.
